revised_title: Experimental Study of Excitation and Dissociation of Hydrogen by Electron Swarms
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the excitation and dissociation of hydrogen by electron swarms in a uniform electric field. They used a novel method to measure the absolute intensity of vacuum ultra-violet radiation using a fluorescent converter, photomultiplier, and scaler. The results showed that dissociation losses account for a large part of the energy balance, and the rate of dissociation of molecular hydrogen in an electrodeless discharge was measured by absorbing the atomic hydrogen formed and observing the rate of decrease of gas pressure.
